COVID-19 vaccines are an important tool to help stop the pandemic. As of January 19, more than 13.5 million people had received their first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine. Pfizer reports that in real life, the vaccine is 97 percent effective against symptomatic COVID and 94 percent effective against asymptomatic disease. These vaccines are a complete and total scientific miracle.

Scariants: The biggest danger with a variant is immune escape, which means evading the body's immune defenses. The South Africa and Brazil variants have shown the potential to reinfect, but vaccines are effective in preventing severe disease and hospitalization. We won't see any great escape.

The solution is not one or the other. That is quite a narrow-minded perspective. While vaccines are scarce, other alternatives must be implemented to curb the spread of Covid-19. And also, it is simply the law of supply and demand at play here, you do not need to politicize it.

COVID-19 vaccines are available, but it is still important for me to take precautions.
